poem:
**Apollo 13 in Retrospect**

In the silent abyss
they navigated
a broken vessel,
Three men floating—
haiku in a void,
oxygen whispers
through wires burnt and frayed.

Stars watched, indifferent.

Back on Earth, children slept,
oblivious to a night
etched with survival.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Apollo 13: Survival review – fascinating, if clinical, retelling of space history On paper, the survival of three astronauts aboard Apollo 13, a Nasa spacecraft bound for the moon and imperiled by a near-fatal explosion in April 1970, is nothing short of astounding. The explosion, over two days and 210,000 miles into the mission, nearly drained the three-part spacecraft of oxygen and electrical power. The three astronauts – Fred Haise, Jack Swigert and mission commander". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
